locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explains the doctrine of justification by faith via Paul's letter to the Galatians, framed by a 1998 New York Times article on a joint Catholic-Lutheran declaration.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High; utilizes scholarly translation and historical-critical context (Martyn) to define 'rectification' and the 'bound will'.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of the Gospel versus religion, with a secondary force of promising the sufficiency of Christ.
voorbeelden: The Christian gospel is not any of that at all.
The gospel is from beginning to end something that God does.
A person is not rectified by works of the Law.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Relief from the burden of self-justification; intellectual shift in understanding 'religion' vs 'gospel'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate; mentions the Spirit as the agent of new life, but less as the agent of the preaching event itself.

voorbeelden: The doctrine of justification lies at the very heart of the faith.
Paul understands himself to have been directly commissioned.
Religion is what people do to escape judgment.
Donâ€™t wait for the Last Judgment.
Let no one make trouble for me any more.
I could hardly believe my eyes.
I must admit I burst out laughing.
God himself has acted to create a completely new situation.
He is himself our deliverance from the judgment.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological content but often framed as a description of God's action rather than a direct 'I promise you' address.

voorbeelden: The balance sheet is made right in Christ.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the text/Paul rather than speaking in the first-person sacramental 'I'.

indicatoren: Lengthy illustration about the New York Times
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a theological debate rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise to the 'you' of the congregation
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Information about grace is received, but the 'event' of being graced is deferred.

voorbeelden: The good news... is that God himself has acted.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Mostly hypothetical or collective 'you' (e.g., 'You may think').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Low; used more for rhetorical engagement than sacramental address.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant; discussing Paul, the Galatians, the Vatican, and 'people'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere where the Gospel is an object of study.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical context of Paul and the Reformation.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Defining what 'The Gospel' is as a concept.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: It avoids moralism (Directive), which is a strength.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from Assertive (Justification) to a concluding Commissive/Declarative.
voorbeelden: The balance sheet is made right in Christ.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Theologically accurate but lacks the 'I-Thou' immediacy of a sacramental event.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: The person who is being set right... will be led by the Holy Spirit to do those things that are right.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant theological lecture that explains the performative nature of the Gospel without fully becoming a performative act itself.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The gospel of Jesus Christ means the end of religion.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Paul says... Paul writes... Paul understands...
zwakke_punten.probleem: The preacher hides behind Paul rather than speaking as a mandatory of Christ.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an 'event' of learning, but only partially an 'event' of encounter.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The language describes the sacrament of the Word but rarely 'administers' it directly to the hearer.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the text of Galatians.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Low; the preacher acts more as a commentator/reporter.
tekstueel_bewijs: I'm going to jump the fence [of the lectionary].

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the one who guides the Christian life.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicit; the preacher trusts the 'radical' nature of the word to work.
tekstueel_bewijs: Lead your daily life guided by the Spirit.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon treats the *doctrine* as the means of grace rather than the *act of preaching*.
tekstueel_bewijs: May it be the same for us.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 3rd person singular verbs (says, writes, is). Needs more 2nd person present tense performatives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: A person is not rectified by works of the Law.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: You are not rectified by your efforts; Christ rectifies you here and now.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a specific, creative declaration.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried in the description of the doctrine.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use 'I' and 'You' to deliver the promise.
voorbeeldzinnen: On behalf of Christ, I promise you: your balance sheet is torn up.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Collapse the distance between the 1st century and today.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the ones Paul is writing to.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain this focus while strengthening the performative indicative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theological exposition that would be transformed into a sacramental event by shifting from 'talking about' the Gospel to 'doing' the Gospel to the congregation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's self-revelation (procrastination); SAT focuses on the illocutionary force of the Word of God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would look at the 'war' metaphor; SAT looks at whether the 'war' is declared or merely described.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that despite the radical content, the linguistic form remains safely descriptive (constative).

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The gospel of Jesus Christ means the end of religion.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High for teaching, low for encounter.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly effective as a 'teaching' sermon but risks 'constative surplus' by keeping the Gospel in the third person.
